sector.narrative: Cash Transfers - social protection data management (management information system, social and beneficiary registries, M&E systems)
Cash Transfers: Delivery of cash transfers through government system (beneficiary identification, grievance mechanisms, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)

Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Delivery of cash transfers or voucher through new and/or parallel system (humanitarian context)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 7.1. By 2021, the government has enhanced capacity and improved systems for the delivery of child sensitive social protection.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued the implementation of the drought-response cash transfer programme reaching 92,202 households (approximately 400,000 people), In addition we successfully developed a COVID-19 emergency cash transfer programme document that has led to resources being mobilised (USD 17 million) for the C-ECT programme. UNICEF continued to nurture the partnership with the World Bank to complement and exchange learning within the social protection sector. UNICEF supported the SCT systems strengthening work through support towards the MIS enhancement, continued roll-out of a grievance mechanism, improvement of payment delivery systems, the implementation of new financial management and reporting systems and strengthened strategic planning framework. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:30/06/2020
